content:
• Friday, March 10, 2017
  • UTSI

    UTStarcom +3.3% as Q4 beats ahead of challenging year

    • UTStarcom Holdings (NASDAQ:UTSI) rose 3.3% on heavy relative volume after it posted beats on top and bottom lines (vs. one estimate) in its Q4 earnings report, but warned of challenges in the year ahead.
    • “We expect 2017 to be challenging as we upgrade and align our main product line to support next generation networks," says CEO Tim Ti. "We are investing in R&D to ensure timely product transitions."
    • Revenues fell 17.5% Y/Y, and gross margin rose 140 basis points to 32%. Net loss of $1M was $13.7M better than the prior year.
    • Net sales from equipment were $16.5M, down 16% mainly due to reduced sales of value-added Third Party Sales, and a drop in its discontinued GEPON product. Services net sales fell 23%.
    • The company said it hired Crowe Horwath to finish its fiscal 2016 audit after ending its relationship with GHP Horwath.
    • For its Q1, the company's guiding to non-GAAP revenue of $18M-$22M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD, RJF, ARE moving as S&P index market cap changes shuffle tickers

    • Stocks are on the move in postmarket trading after S&P Dow Jones Indices has made adjustments to the market cap definitions of its indexes that have resulted in some ticker shuffling.
    • Effective today, the S&P 500 has a market cap guideline of $6.1B or greater (up from a previous $5.3B). In addition, the S&P MidCap 400 now ranges in market caps from $1.6B to $6.8B (up from $1.4B-$5.9B), and the S&P SmallCap 600 goes from $450M to $2.1B (up from $400M-$1.8B).
    • S&P says the moves are due to a market that has risen 5.5% this year and 19% over the past 12 months. The changes are effect before the open March 20.
    • Three members of the 500 are switching places with three in the MidCap 400, and three more in the 400 will trade with three constituents of the SmallCap 600.
    • Moving from MidCap to the S&P 500: AMD (up 3.2% after hours); Raymond James Financial (RJF, up 0.9% after hours) and Alexandria Real Estate Equities (ARE, up 1% after hours). Moving to the MidCap 400 from the 500 to make room for them: Urban Outfitters (URBN, down 1.3% postmarket), Frontier Communications (FTR, down 0.4% late) and First Solar (FSLR, down 1.9% postmarket).
    • Meanwhile, moving up to the MidCap 400 from the SmallCap 600: TTWO, MASI, COHR. Moving down to the SmallCap 600 to take their place: FOSL, DNR, VSTO (up 0.2% after hours).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 213 Comments
  • CMLS

    With court rejection, Cumulus Media terminates note exchange

    • Cumulus Media (CMLS -1.9%) has terminated its private exchange offer for its 7.75% senior notes due 2019, expecting the conditions for the exchange can't be satisfied due to court action.
    • "As a result of a recent ruling in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, the Company has concluded that the conditions to the Exchange Offer have not and will not be satisfied," the company says in a statement.
    • Last month, U.S. District Judge Katherine Polk Failla rejected the company's debt refinancing plan, which had been opposed by some lenders.
    • The company says it will continue to evaluate alternatives for its capital structure.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 1 Comment

  • VIA

    Hulu live TV will feature A&E, but not Viacom networks

    • In its anticipated live TV service, Hulu will offer A&E networks, but won't include networks from Viacom (VIA -0.2%, VIAB -1.6%) -- leaving out some struggling but still key brands like MTV, Comedy Central and Nickelodeon.
    • The service (co-owned by Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), Disney (NYSE:DIS), Fox (FOX, FOXA) and Time Warner (NYSE:TWX)) couldn't come to terms with Viacom on its stations, but instead points to A&E content it will have: not only the flagship network, but also History, Lifetime and Viceland.
    • That's the latest indicator that some companies with only cable channels and no broadcast channels face a struggle getting included in the "new packages" that are being formed with the advent of more streaming TV services. The deal could also make it even tougher for AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX), Scripps Networks Interactive (NYSE:SNI) and Discovery (NASDAQ:DISCA) to squeeze into the Hulu service.
    • A&E is co-owned by Disney and Hearst.
    • Meanwhile, as part of moves to shore up relations with traditional distributors, Viacom had already removed its programs from on-demand service offered by Amazon.com and Hulu.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 5 Comments

  • IAG

    Iamgold bond offering cuts long-term debt, extends maturity to 2025

    • Iamgold (IAG +6.7%) is sharply higher after pricing a private offering of $400M in senior notes due 2025, with proceeds going toward redeeming its $489M outstanding 6.75% senior notes due October 2020.
    • IAG says reducing long-term debt and extending the maturity date of its notes to 2025 improves its capital structure and supports the ability to fund growth pipeline over the four-year horizon and beyond.
    • Analyst Harry Koza of IFR Markets Canada says the offering raised less than anticipated, but shares are higher anyway.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments

  • Oil slides further, down nearly 10% for the week

    • WTI crude is off another 1.8% this session to $48.38 per barrel, and now down more than 9% for the week.
    • The weekly dive was helped along by a huge rise in inventories reported late Tuesday and Wednesday, and the catalyst today was another rise in active oil rigs.
    • “The uptrend in U.S. crude stocks…has now become the dominant fundamental concern,” says Citi Futures' Tim Evans.
    • USO -2.5%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, DWT, OILK, OILX, UWT
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 34 Comments
  • STRP

    Straight Path -2.8% as penalties widen quarterly losses

    • Straight Path Communications (NYSEMKT:STRP) is 2.8% lower following a fiscal Q2 report where revenues jumped but net loss jumped due to a FCC consent decree penalty and a multimillion-dollar stockholder settlement.
    • The quarter's loss from operations of $25.8M included full accrual of $15M for the company's civil penalty, as well as $7.2M tied to settling class action litigation.
    • Net loss was $25.4M, vs. the prior year's loss of $2M.
    • Cash and equivalents as of Jan. 31 were $7.8M ($10.3M on a pro forma basis).
    • Conference call to come at 4:15 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 19 Comments

  • FNSR

    Finisar widely reissued bullishly amid 21%+ decline

    • Despite reverberation of Finisar's at-issue Q3 2017 reporting across the optical sector (NeoPhotonics -9%, Oclaro -7.1%, Fabrinet -5.6%, Applied Optoelectronics -3.5%, Acacia Communications -3%,), analyst coverage of the name remains confidently steady.
    • Reissuing at Strong Buy ($44 target), analyst Alex Henderson (Needham & Company) notes frustration over deficient execution and greater-than-anticipated seasonal slowing, though longer-term, considers thesis intact. Similarly dismayed by execution missteps and forward estimates, analyst Simon Leopold (Raymond James; Outperform, $40 target) nonetheless anticipates improving potential for involvement in 3D sensing opportunities to offset forecast decreases.
    • Maintaining at Buy and $41 target, analyst Michael Genovese (MKM Partners) views the event as indicative of a "fairly gentle Optical slowdown with a good chance of re-acceleration in 2HCY17," while Stifel (analyst Patrick Newton; Buy, $39 target) and William Blair (analyst Dmitry Netis; Outperform) issue likewise encouraging sentiment.
    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) $27.37.
    • Yesterday (March 9, 2017): Finisar -16.2%; Q3 2017, FY outlook off expectations / earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 10 Comments

  • VIA

    Report: Chinese acquisition delay threatens Paramount's $1B financing deal

    • A delay in a Chinese acquisition presents a threat to a $1B film financing deal reached earlier this year by Paramount Pictures (VIA -0.9%, VIAB -2%), TheWrap reports.
    • The deal's in jeopardy as regulatory issues have delayed a planned acquisition of Huahua Media by Oriental Time Media. Huahua and Shanghai Film Group had set a deal to finance 25% of Paramount's films for three years with a fourth-year option.
    • Oriental Time agreed in November to pay about $158M for Huahua, but withdrew its offer yesterday amid dozens of questions from the China Securities Regulatory Commission. And that will prevent Huahua from funding the $1B Paramount deal, a source told TheWrap.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • RDUS

    Radius Health down 10% on delay of FDA action on abaloparatide

    • Radius Health (RDUS -9.5%) slumps on triple normal volume in response to its announcement that the FDA needs more time to review its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of Abaloparatide-SC for the treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Specifically, the agency needs the extra time to review information submitted by the company in response to its requests.
    • The FDA's new action date is June 30 which reflects the standard 90-day extension period from the original PDUFA date of March 30.
    • On the plus side, Shire is reportedly still interested in a takeover. Observers believe the bid price could be as high as $80 a share.
    • Previously: Shire still eyeing Radius Health, shares up 3% (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 15 Comments

    ASML Holding +2.75%; upgraded to Buy at UBS

    • From Neutral, analyst Gareth Jenkins notes SPIE (and in particular, Intel) indicates validation of advances toward industrialization of ASML Holding's next-generation EUV solutions, while also citing checks indicating equipping among Chinese semiconductor manufacturers that's set to commence, in addition to the formation of a roadmap beyond EUV that's beginning to form.

  • FMSA

    Fairmount Santrol upgraded to Buy at Jefferies following pullback

    • Fairmount Santrol (FMSA +2.1%) bounces back a bit from yesterday's 16% plunge following disappointing Q4 results.
    • Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $10 price target, saying it remains comfortable with medium-term frac sand industry supply and demand fundamentals, and that the 41% pullback over the past two weeks is an overreaction.
    • Other frac sand names are mixed in today's trade: SLCA +1.6%, HCLP +0.1%, EMES -0.7%, SND -2%.

    ON Semiconductor targets $5.6B revenue, $2 EPS for 2020

    • Issuing target model as part of the company's investor day presentation, ON Semiconductor additionally sets expectations for 40% gross margin, 21% operating expense, 19% operating margin, $950M profit before tax, 12% cash tax rate and $900M of free cash flow for the 2020 term.
    • ON Semiconductor (NASDAQ:ON) $15.50, +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • SCYX

    SCYNEXIS spikes 8% on reports of deadly fungal infection in U.S. that could be treated with lead product candidate SCY-078

    • Nano cap SCYNEXIS (SCYX +7.6%) perks up on the news that over 30 Americans have been diagnosed with a highly drug-resistant fungal infection caused by a yeast strain called Candida auris. Health officials first warned U.S. physicians last June about the spread of infections, now documented on five continents.
    • This particular C. auris infection is systemic and is easily spread in healthcare settings. Some strains are resistant to all three major classes of antifungal drugs. The mortality rate can be up to 60%.
    • SCYNEXIS' lead product candidate is SCY-078, an inhibitor of an enzyme called glucan synthase, that is active against multi-drug-resistant pathogens, including those resistant to echinocandins, a class of antifungal drugs. The development of a IV formulation has been delayed, however, on safety signals reported in a Phase 1 study.
    • Previously: SCYNEXIS' IV SCY-078 on clinical hold pending investigation of adverse events in early-stage study; shares down 31% after hours (March 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 1 Comment

  • TD

    TD Bank stung by report of Wells Fargo-like practices

    • The Canadian banks are in the green, with the exception of TD Bank (TD -2.5%) after a CBC News report about the pressures put on branch employees to sign up customers for products they don't need.
    • "When I come into work, I have to put my ethics aside and not do what's right for the customer," says one teller.
    • "It's a choice between keeping my job and feeding my family … or doing what's right for the customer," says another.
    • According to the report, teller's sales revenue goals have more than tripled in the past three years.
    • While declining a request to be interviewed, TD disputes any allegation that products or services are sold to ill-informed customers who may not need them or know how much they cost.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 146 Comments
  • AMFW

    Amec Foster Wheeler +3% after winning two Middle East contracts

    • Amec Foster Wheeler (AMFW +3.2%) is higher after announcing that it was awarded two contracts in Brunei and Kuwait.
    • AMFW says a five-year contract by Brunei Shell Petroleum is for the rejuvenation of assets in Brunei, and a six-year contract by Kuwait Petroleum Company is for the integration project between its Olefins III, Aromatics II and ZOR refinery.
    • No financial details are provided.

  • DISH

    Dish Network to sell $1B in convertible notes for strategic deals

    • Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) is off 1.8% after announcing a plan to sell $1B in convertible notes.
    • The company plans to use net proceeds for strategic transactions, "which may include wireless and spectrum-related strategic transactions," and general purposes.
    • They're unsecured obligations, and the company will be able to satisfy conversion obligations in any mix of cash and Class A common stock. Other terms are still subject to negotiation.

    More on Genesco's Q4

    • FY2018 Guidance: Comparable sales: +2% to +3%; Adjusted EPS: $4.40 to $4.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CATB

    Catabasis running, shares jump 76% in two days

    • Nano cap Catabasis Pharmaceuticals (CATB +52.6%) jumps out of the blocks for the second consecutive day. Shares have jumped almost 76% since Wednesday. No particular news accounts for the move. The company plans to release Q4 and full-year results on Thursday, March 16 after the close.
    • Shares cratered in late January after a mid-stage study assessing DMD candidate edasalonexent failed to achieve its primary endpoint.
    • Previously: Catabasis Pharma's edasalonexent flops in randomized portion of mid-stage DMD study; shares crater 58% after hours (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • FRPT

    Freshpet races higher on enthusiasm over marketing plan

    • Freshpet (NASDAQ:FRPT) jumps 11% after the company sets FY17 revenue guidance slightly ahead of estimates, $153M vs. $151M consensus.
    • CEO Billy Cyr says the company's plan for this year is to ramp up marketing.
    • Cyr on strategy: "In 2017, we will begin to increase our investment in media to drive brand awareness. Over time we expect this new level of spend will increase same store sales and grow new store penetration. We have tested this media strategy over the last several months and are pleased with the results to-date."
    • Shares of Freshpet broke over $11 for the first time in over two weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • HIBB

    More on Hibbett Sports' Q4

    • Hibbett Sports (HIBB +5.4%) reports comparable-store sales fell 2.2% in Q4.
    • Gross margin rate slipped 180 bps to 33% due to markdowns taken to reduce inventory, a negative effect of product mix due to higher footwear sales, and de-leverage of logistics and store occupancy expenses associated with lower comparable store sales.
    • Store operating, selling, and administrative expenses rate grew 140 bps to 23.8%.
    • Operating margin rate down 350 bps to 7.7%.
    • Store count +34 Y/Y to 1,078.
    • FY2018 Guidance: Comparable-store sales: Low-single digit range growth; Gross margin: relatively flat; Diluted EPS: $2.65 to $2.85; Capex: ~$25M to $30M; New stores: ~50 to 60.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • TEUM

    Pareteum halted after 44% jump

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) is halted after a premarket spike of 44.4%, for news pending.
    • In a filing, the company had noted that on March 7 it got conversion notices from holders of $1.15M worth (about 115 shares) of its Series A and A-1 convertible preferred stock.
    • Those shares will converted into common stock at a 13% discount to a public offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • BT

    BT Group +4.2% as it agrees to split Openreach unit from company

    • BT Group (NYSE:BT) is up 4.2% in U.S. premarket trading after coming to a deal with regulator Ofcom on the legal separation of its Openreach infrastructure unit.
    • The move was strongly resisted by the incumbent telecom for some time even as pressure mounted from rivals who feared unfair treatment in needing to buy key wholesale services from their competitor.
    • Openreach will be legally separate from BT, with its own board. It will take on about 32,000 employees. The company's leadership will only have accountability to BT's CEO when it comes to some legal and fidicuiary duties tied to BT's public listing.
    • So with BT agreeing to requested changes, Ofcom says it won't need to force those changes with regulations.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

    Zogenix top line up 81%; net loss widens; going concern risk weighs on shares, down 7%

    • Shares are down 7% premarket pressured by its accounting firm's opinion that its losses and negative cash flows create "substantial doubt" over its ability to continue as a going concern (10-K, pages 34-35).

  • MTN

    Higher ticket prices help boost Vail Resorts

    • Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN) is higher in premarket action after showing stronger numbers for FQ2 than anticipated.
    • The company's lift revenue jumped 25% as the Whistler acquisition kicked in.

    • Season-to-date metrics (through March 5): Lift revenue +6.7%, ancillary spending +5.2%, skier visits -4.0%.
    • MTN +3.64% premarket to $187.00.

    Endocyte expects to have $100M cash balance by year end; collaboration with SCRI announced; shares ahead 7% premarket

    | 8:57 AM
  • JBLU

    Steady traffic numbers from JetBlue

    • February load factor -50 bps to 82.6%. YTD load factor +10 bps to 83.0%.
    • The company says preliminary revenue per available seat mile increased 1.5% Y/Y during February. Q1 unit revenue is expected to fall 4% to 5%.
    • JBLU -0.13% premarket to $19.05.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 21 Comments
  • CARA

    Cara Therapeutics Q4 expenses up 130%, top-line data from Phase 2/3 study of IV CR845 expected this month; shares ease 9% premarket

    • Cara Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CARA) Q4 results ($M): Operating Expenses: 22.3 (+129.9%); Net Loss: (22.0) (-130.5%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Quick assets should be sufficient to fund operations through Q1 2018.
    • Key 2017 milestones: Q1: top-line data from Part A of Phase 2/3 trial of IV CR845 in dialysis patients with moderate-to-severe uremic pruritus; Q2: top-line data from Phase 2b study of oral CR845 in osteoarthritis-associated pain; Q2: Phase 1 data on IV CR845 on respiratory drive after bolus infusion in healthy volunteers.
    • Janney Capital raised price target to $20 (14% upside) from $18. On March 3, Piper reiterated Overweight rating and $23 (32% upside) price target.
    • Shares are down 9% premarket on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM

  • Futures add to advance after strong jobs numbers

    • Revisions to December and January don't amount to much, so we can call the 235K jobs added in February a modest beat over the 200K expected.
    • Average workweek was unchanged at 34.4 hours.
    • Average hourly earnings up $0.06 to $26.09; up 2.8% on a Y/Y basis.
    • Construction employment was the big mover in February, with 58K jobs added.
    • Headline unemployment dipped to 4.7% from 4.8% even as the labor force participation rate edged higher to 63%. The broader U-6 unemployment rate fell to 9.2% from 9.4%. One year ago, it was 9.8%.
    • Treasury yields are active since the report hit, with the 10-year currently flat at 2.605%. TLT -0.1%, TBT +0.2% premarket. The news is surely not going to move the Fed off of its near-promise to hike rates next week.
    • The dollar (UUP, UDN) has turned modestly lower, as has gold (NYSEARCA:GLD).
    • U.S. stock index futures (SPY, QQQ, DIA) have all added to gains, now up 0.45% across the board.
    • Previously: Job gain of 235K tops estimates; UE rate drops to 4.7% (March 10)

    Exxon-BP takeover chatter resurfaces in London

    • Market rumors in London say Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) has reached out to major BP shareholders regarding a potential takeover, the U.K.'s Evening Standard reports.
    • XOM and BP have several top shareholders in common, including BlackRock and Vanguard, and according to the chatter, BP is concerned impatient shareholders will urge it to do a deal if it cannot create value on its own, much like Unilever’s decision to launch a review of options after rejecting Kraft Heinz’s bid.
    • In another twist, Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, [RDS.B]]) supposedly would be prepared to swoop in with its own bid to save the day and keep BP on British soil if XOM makes an approach.

    Valeant upsizes debt offering to $3.25B; shares ahead 3% premarket

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) increases the aggregate size of its previously announced debt offering by $750M to $3.25B. The upsized offering now consists of $1.25B of 6.5% senior secured notes due 2022 and $2B of 7.00% senior secured notes due 2024.
    • Net proceeds, together with a new term loan, will fund the repayment of outstanding indebtedness under its credit facilities and the repurchase of $1.1B (up from $600M) of its 6.75% Senior Notes due 2018. Valeant anticipates that it will pay down $350M of borrowings under its credit revolver.
    • Closing date is March 21.
